burton.name: Burton-on-Trent
burton.description: Extremely hard water, high in sulfates. Made Burton IPAs famous for their dry, crisp hop character.
burton.history: The high sulfate content of Burton water accentuates hop bitterness and creates the characteristic 'Burton Snatch' - a sulfury, minerally quality.

dublin.name: Dublin
dublin.description: Moderately hard with high bicarbonate, perfect for dark beers.
dublin.history: The high alkalinity of Dublin water neutralizes the acidity of dark roasted malts, creating smooth stouts like Guinness.

pilsen.name: Pilsen (Plzeň)
pilsen.description: Extremely soft water, ideal for delicate pale lagers.
pilsen.history: The soft water of Pilsen allowed brewers to create the first golden lager, Pilsner Urquell, in 1842.

london.name: London
london.description: Moderate mineral content with balanced sulfate and chloride.
london.history: London water's moderate carbonate level made it suitable for brown ales and porters.

munich.name: Munich (München)
munich.description: Moderately hard with high carbonates, ideal for dark lagers.
munich.history: Munich's carbonate-rich water led to the development of dark lagers like Dunkel and Bock.

dortmund.name: Dortmund
dortmund.description: Very hard water with balanced sulfate and chloride.
dortmund.history: Dortmund's minerally water created the Export style - a balanced, slightly sweet pale lager.

vienna.name: Vienna
vienna.description: Hard water with high sulfates and bicarbonates.
vienna.history: Vienna's water led to amber lagers with a dry finish, though the style is now rare in Vienna itself.

edinburgh.name: Edinburgh
edinburgh.description: Similar to Burton but with more chloride, good for Scottish ales.
edinburgh.history: Edinburgh's water created malty, slightly sweet Scottish ales and the famous Scottish 80/- ales.

yorkshire.name: Yorkshire
yorkshire.description: High sulfate water excellent for hoppy bitters.
yorkshire.history: Yorkshire water produces crisp, hoppy bitters with excellent head retention.

antwerp.name: Antwerp
antwerp.description: Balanced water suitable for Belgian ales.
antwerp.history: Antwerp's water contributes to the complexity of Belgian ales, particularly Abbey and Trappist styles.
